titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2209) making appropriations for the Legislative Branch for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1998, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 105-202, by Ms. Pryce (OH).

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2209 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Measure will be read by section. Specified amendments are in order. No amendment shall be in order except those amendments printed in the report accompanying this resolution, to be considered in the order and manner specified. The Chairman of the Committee of the Whole may postpone until a time during further consideration a request for a recorded vote on any amendment and reduce to five minutes the minimum time for a vote on any postponed question that follows another electronic vote without intervening business, provided that the minimum time for voting on the first in any series shall be 15 minutes.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 69.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
DEBATE - The House continued with debate on H. Res. 197.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 222 - 201 (Roll no. 324).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 218 - 203 (Roll No. 325).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 7/24/1997--Introduced. Sets forth the rule (modified closed) for the consideration of H.R. 2209 (legislative branch appropriations).
